thing-type.label: FGDW002 Fibaro Door Window Sensor 2
thing-type.description: Fibaro Door Window Sensor 2<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtFIBARO Door/Window Sensor 2 is a wireless, battery powered Hall effect contact sensor, compatible with the Z-Wave Plus standard. Changing the device’s status will automatically send signal to the Z-Wave controller and associated devices.</p&gt <p&gtSensor can be used to trigger scenes and wherever there is a need for information about opening or closing of doors, windows, garage doors, etc. Opening is detected by separating the sensor’s body and the magnet.</p&gt <p&gtIn addition the FIBARO Door/Window Sensor 2 is equipped with a built-in temperature sensor.</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtMain features of FIBARO Door/Window Sensor 2</strong&gt</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtCompatible with any Z-Wave or Z-Wave+ Controller,</li&gt <li&gtSupports protected mode (Z-Wave network Security Mode) with AES-128 encryption</li&gt <li&gtDoor/window opening detected through separation of Sensor’s body and a magnet</li&gt <li&gtBuilt-in temperature sensor</li&gt <li&gtDetects tampering, when detached or opened</li&gt <li&gtEasily mounted on doors, windows, garage gates and roller blinds</li&gt <li&gtBattery powered</li&gt <li&gtVisual LED indicator signalling status of the device</li&gt <li&gt7 color variations.</li&gt </ul&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtPlace the Door/Window Sensor 2 within the direct range of your Z-Wave controller.</li&gt <li&gtSet the main controller in (Security/non-Security Mode) add mode (see the controller’s manual).</li&gt <li&gtQuickly, three times press one of the TMP buttons (while the other button is pressed).</li&gt <li&gtWait for the adding process to end.</li&gt <li&gtSuccessful adding will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message.</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtPlace the Door/Window Sensor 2 within the direct range of your Z-Wave controller.</li&gt <li&gtSet the main controller into remove mode (see the controller’s manual).</li&gt <li&gtQuickly, three times press one of the TMP buttons (while the other button is pressed).</li&gt <li&gtWait for the removing process to end.</li&gt <li&gtSuccessful removing will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message.</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtWakeup Information</h2&gt<p&gtAvailable settings: 0 or 3600-64800 (in seconds (1-18h), 3600s (1h) step). Default setting: 21600 seconds (6h)</p&gt <p&gtThe Door/Window Sensor will wake up after each defined time interval and always try to connect with the main controller. After a successful communication attempt, the sensor will update configuration parameters, associations and settings and will go into standby mode.</p&gt <p&gtAfter failed communication attempt (e.g. lack of Z-Wave range) the device will go into standby mode and retry to establish connection with the main controller after the next time interval.</p&gt <p&gtSetting wake up interval to 0 disables sending Wake Up Notification frame automatically. Wake up may be still performed manually by a clicking one of the TMP buttons (while the other button is pressed).</p&gt

parameter.name: config_1_1
parameter.label: 1: Door/window state
parameter.description: What state is door/window when the magnet is close to the sensor<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0 - closed when magnet near</p&gt <p&gt1 - opened when magnet near</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_2_1_00000001
parameter.label: 2: Visual LED indications - Open/close
parameter.description: Visual LED indications - Open/close<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSet or reset the indication of opening/closing status change (input IN) by the visual LED indicator.<br /&gtDisabling events might extend battery life.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_2_1_00000002
parameter.label: 2: Visual LED indications - wake up
parameter.description: Visual LED indications - wake up<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtShow indication of wake up events by the visual LED indicator.<br /&gtDisabling events might extend battery life.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_2_1_00000004
parameter.label: 2: Visual LED indications - tampering
parameter.description: Visual LED indications - tampering<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtEnable or disable device tampering events indicated by the visual LED indicator.<br /&gtDisabling events might extend battery life.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_3_1
parameter.label: 3: Associations in Z-Wave network Security Mode
parameter.description: Associations in Z-Wave network Security Mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines how commands are sent in specified association groups: as secure or non-secure. Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network Security Mode. It does not apply to 1st group "Lifeline".</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: none of the groups sent as secure

parameter.name: config_11_1
parameter.label: 11: 2nd association group triggers
parameter.description: 2nd association group triggers<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtParameter defines events which result in sending on/off commands to devices added to the 2nd association group.</p&gt <p&gtThese commands are sent alternately to switch the devices on and off.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_12_2
parameter.label: 12: Value of ON command sent to 2nd association group
parameter.description: Value of ON command frame sent to 2nd association group<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtValue sent to devices in 2nd association group when opening is detected The value of 0 turns OFF the device, 255 turns it ON. In case of associating devices allowing smooth control, values 1-99 allow to set an associated device to a specified level.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_13_2
parameter.label: 13: Value of OFF command sent to 2nd association group
parameter.description: Value of OFF command frame sent to 2nd association group<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtValue sent to devices in 2nd association group when closing is detected The value of 0 turns OFF the device, 255 turns it ON. In case of associating devices allowing smooth control, values 1-99 allow to set an associated device to a specified level.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_14_2
parameter.label: 14: Association for opening - time delay
parameter.description: Association for opening - time delay<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtTime that must elapse from opening to send the command frame to to devices in 2nd association group.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_15_2
parameter.label: 15: Association for closing - time delay
parameter.description: Association for closing - time delay<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtTime (in seconds) that must elapse from closing to send the command frame to devices in 2nd association group</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_30_2
parameter.label: 30: Tamper - alarm cancellation delay
parameter.description: Tamper - alarm cancellation delay<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtTime period after which a tamper alarm will be cancelled.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_31_1
parameter.label: 31: Tamper - reporting alarm cancellation
parameter.description: Tamper - reporting alarm cancellation<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtReporting cancellation of tamper alarm to the controller and 3rd association group.</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: do not send tamper cancellation report

parameter.name: config_50_2
parameter.label: 50: Interval of temperature measurements
parameter.description: Interval of temperature measurements<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines how often the temperature will be measured. The shorter the time, the more frequently the temperature will be measured, but the battery life will shorten.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_51_2
parameter.label: 51: Temperature reports threshold
parameter.description: Temperature reports threshold<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines the change of temperature in comparison with last reported, resulting in temperature report being sent to the main controller.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gt0 - temperature reports based on threshold disabled</li&gt <li&gt1-300 - temperature threshold (0.1-30°C, 0.1°C step)</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_52_2
parameter.label: 52: Interval of temperature reports
parameter.description: Interval of temperature reports<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines how often the temperature reports will be sent to the main controller (regardless of parameters 50 and 51).</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gt0 - periodic temperature reports disabled</li&gt <li&gt300-32400 - time in seconds</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_53_2
parameter.label: 53: Temperature offset
parameter.description: Temperature offset<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe value to be added to the actual temperature, measured by the sensor (temperature compensation). Available settings: -1000–1000 (-100–100°C, 0.1°C step)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_54_1
parameter.label: 54: Temperature alarm reports
parameter.description: Temperature alarm reports<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtTemperature alarms reported to the Z-Wave controller. Thresholds are set in parameters 55 and 56. Available settings: 0 - temperature alarms disabled 1 - high temperature alarm 2 - low temperature alarm 3 - high and low temperature alarms enabled</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: high and low temperature alarms enabled

parameter.name: config_55_2
parameter.label: 55: High temperature alarm threshold
parameter.description: High temperature alarm threshold<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtIf temperature is higher than set value, overheat notification will be sent and high temperature alarm will be triggered (if activated).</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gt1-600 (0.1-60°C, 0.1°C step)</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_56_2
parameter.label: 56: Low temperature alarm threshold
parameter.description: Low temperature alarm threshold<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtIf temperature is lower than the set value, underheat notification will be sent and low temperature alarm will be triggered (if activated). Available settings: 0-599 (0-59.9°C, 0.1°C step)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: group_1
parameter.label: 1: Lifeline
parameter.description: reports the device status and allows for assigning single device only (main controller by default).<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtreports the device status and allows for assigning single device only (main controller by default).</p&gt

parameter.name: group_2
parameter.label: 2: On/Off
parameter.description: is assigned to the device status - Hall effect sensor (sends Basic Set command frames)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtis assigned to the device status - Hall effect sensor (sends Basic Set command frames).</p&gt

parameter.name: group_3
parameter.label: 3: Tamper
parameter.description: is assigned to the TMP switch (sends alarm command frames)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtis assigned to the TMP switch (sends alarm command frames)</p&gt
